cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles east of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting north, then turning north-northeast toward the Mississippi/Alabama Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Alabama-Mississippi border coast (between the mouth of the Pearl River and Navarre, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning east of Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL; Storm-surge Warning from the mouth of the Mississippi River to the Okaloosa/Walton County line FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning east of the mouth of the Pearl River to Navarre FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may occasionally bring gusts below tropical-storm force; sustained gale-force winds are unlikely (≤4% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft along the west-central Florida coast possible, but values above 3 ft are not expected in Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent rain from outer bands; local heavier showers possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf along the west-central Florida coast.
